data.title: Cooking passion
data.statement:
You love cooking. Therefore, you often go to the shop to buy ingredients for your recipes. Sometimes, you can't, so you ask your dog to go. But he can't read numbers, so he doesn't buy the quantities you need. Given the recipe and the list of ingredients your dog bought, with their respective quantities, find how many times you can cook this meal before you run out of an ingredient.
Output the first ingredient that will be running out, how many times you can cook, and how much of each ingredient you will have left.

testCases.title: Simple Recipe
testCases.testIn:
5 3
- 100g Butter
- 500g Flour
- 500g Sugar
Mix it all together
Eat it !
Butter 400g
Flour 1000g
Sugar 1500g

testCases.title: Simple Recipe
testCases.testIn:
4 3
- 200g Butter
- 400g Chocolate
- 450g Sugar
Mix
Butter 700g
Chocolate 1200g
Sugar 1500g

testCases.title: kilograms
testCases.testIn:
5 3
- 0.1kg Butter
- 0.4kg Flour
- 0.2kg Sugar
Mix it all together
Eat it !
Butter 400g
Flour 1.2kg
Sugar 2.5kg

testCases.title: kilograms
testCases.testIn:
4 3
- 200g Butter
- 400g Chocolate
- 1.0kg Sugar
Mix
Butter 700g
Chocolate 1.2kg
Sugar 4.0kg

testCases.title: Order + liquid
testCases.testIn:
9 5
- 30g Flour
- 40g Butter
Make a roux with the butter and flour.
Add 0.25L of water
- 5g beef bouillon cube
- 10cl Tarragon vinegar
- 5g pepper
Add the stock cube, a tablespoon of tarragon vinegar and a teaspoon of mignonette pepper.
Make it thicker. Serve.
Tarragon vinegar 35cl
pepper 17g
Flour 90g
beef bouillon cube 30g
Butter 150g
testCases.testOut:
Flour
3
pepper 2g
beef bouillon cube 15g
Butter 30g
Tarragon vinegar 5cl

testCases.title: Order + liquid
testCases.testIn:
10 5
- 30g Flour
- 40g Butter
Make a roux with the butter and flour.
Add 0.25L of water
- 5g beef bouillon cube
- 10cl Tarragon vinegar
- 5g pepper
Add the stock cube, a tablespoon of tarragon vinegar and a teaspoon of mignonette pepper.
Make it thicker.
Serve.
pepper 23g
Flour 130g
beef bouillon cube 35g
Butter 160g
Tarragon vinegar 45cl
testCases.testOut:
Butter
4
pepper 3g
Flour 10g
beef bouillon cube 15g
Tarragon vinegar 5cl

testCases.title: Your dog is rich
testCases.testIn:
10 6
- 100g Prawns
- 5cl Oil
In a large saucepan, brown the shelled prawns in oil (2 to 3 minutes). 
- 40cl Coconut milk
- 1g turmeric
- 1g curry
- 4g Bay leaves
When cooked, add the coconut milk, turmeric, curry and bay leaves. Salt and pepper.
Cook over medium heat until the coconut milk is very yellow (7 to 10 min).
Remove the bay leaves and serve immediately with white rice.
Bay leaves 5.2kg
turmeric 654g
curry 256.0kg
Coconut milk 9876.54L
Prawns 15.0kg
Oil 99999cl
testCases.testOut:
Prawns
150
turmeric 504g
Bay leaves 4.6kg
curry 255.85kg
Oil 992.49L
Coconut milk 9816.54L

testCases.title: Your dog is poor
testCases.testIn:
10 6
- 100g Prawns
- 5cl Oil
In a large saucepan, brown the shelled prawns in oil (2 to 3 minutes). 
- 40cl Coconut milk
- 1g turmeric
- 1g curry
- 4g Bay leaves
When cooked, add the coconut milk, turmeric, curry and bay leaves. Salt and pepper.
Cook over medium heat until the coconut milk is very yellow (7 to 10 min).
Remove the bay leaves and serve immediately with white rice. (if you have some).
Bay leaves 8g
turmeric 3g
curry 5g
Coconut milk 82cl
Prawns 202g
Oil 11cl
testCases.testOut:
Bay leaves
2
turmeric 1g
Prawns 2g
curry 3g
Oil 1cl
Coconut milk 2cl

testCases.title: J'aime la ratatouille
testCases.testIn:
21 11
- 0.5kg Tomatoes
Cut the peeled tomatoes into quarters,
- 0.35kg Eggplant
- 0.35kg Zucchini
eggplant and zucchini into slices.
- 0.35kg Red and green pepper
Slice the pepper into strips
- 0.35kg Onion
and the onion in rings
- 3cl Olive oil
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan, and melt the onions and peppers in it.
- 20g Garlic
- 20g Thyme
- 1g Bay leaf
When they are tender, add the tomatoes, chopped garlic, thyme and bay leaf.
- 2g Salt
- 2g Pepper
Salt and pepper and simmer gently, covered, for 45 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the eggplant and zucchini. Cook them separately or not in olive oil for 15 minutes.
Check the cooking of the vegetables so that they are no longer firm. Then add them to the tomato mixture and continue cooking over a very low heat for 10 minutes.
Salt and pepper if necessary.
Tomatoes 2.5kg
Zucchini 1.5kg
Eggplant 1.3kg
Onion 1200g
Red and green pepper 1.15kg
Thyme 100g
Garlic 85g
Salt 10g
Pepper 6g
Bay leaf 4g
Olive oil 10cl
testCases.testOut:
Pepper
3
Bay leaf 1g
Salt 4g
Garlic 25g
Thyme 40g
Red and green pepper 100g
Onion 150g
Eggplant 250g
Zucchini 450g
Tomatoes 1.0kg
Olive oil 1cl

testCases.title: BAGUETTE
testCases.testIn:
15 7
- 400g Eggs
Place the eggs in a saucepan of boiling water for 20 min. Preheat the oven to 180°C.
- 400g Butter
- 0.8kg Diced ham
- 1.2kg St Moret
- 500g Gruyere
- 200g Pickles
Cut the butter into small pieces, mix all the ingredients (the pickles cut into small pieces) add the hard-boiled eggs cut into small pieces.
- 1000g BAGUETTE
Cut the baguette lengthwise, remove the crumb and stuff with the mixture.
Wrap the baguette in aluminum foil (tightly packed).
Place in the oven for 20 minutes at 180 ° C.
Let cool for 30 min then put in the fridge overnight.
Cut the baguette with an electric knife.
Serve.
Eggs 1.25kg
Butter 1.2kg
Diced ham 1.8kg
St Moret 3.0kg
Gruyere 1500g
Pickles 400g
BAGUETTE 1000.0kg
testCases.testOut:
Pickles
2
Diced ham 200g
Butter 400g
Eggs 450g
Gruyere 500g
St Moret 600g
BAGUETTE 998.0kg

testCases.title: Mix and twist
testCases.testIn:
4 2
- 200g Cheese
- 200g Banana
Mix
Twist
Cheese 1.0kg
Banana 1.01kg

testCases.title: Mix and twist
testCases.testIn:
4 2
- 250g Herring
- 150g Pear
Mix
Twist
Herring 14.75kg
Pear 0.45kg

data.constraints:
1<[[num_ingredients]]⩽[[num_recipe]]<50
0<length of a line<500
The quantity of [[limiting_ingredient]] in grams is a multiple of the quantity needed in the recipe, therefore [[num_cooking]] is an integer.
There is only one [[limiting_ingredient]].
data.stubGenerator:
read numRecipe:int numIngredients:int
loop numRecipe read line:string(500)
loop numIngredients read line:string(500)
write limiting_ingredient
numCooking
ingredient+quantity
data.inputDescription:
First line: Two integers [[num_recipe]] and [[num_ingredients]], respectively the number of lines of the recipe and the number of ingredients your dog bought
[[num_recipe]] following lines: A line of the recipe, either an ingredient (beginning with {{-}}, then its quantity and its name) or a line to ignore (not beginning with {{-}})
[[num_ingredients]] following lines: An ingredient (its name and its quantity) your dog bought

Each quantity is either an integer in <<g>> / <<cl>> or a float in <<kg>> (1000g = 1.0kg) / <<L>> (100cl = 1.0L)
data.outputDescription:
First line: [[limiting_ingredient]] The ingredient that will run out first
Second line: [[num_cooking]] How many times you can cook the meal before you run out of [[limiting_ingredient]]
[[num_ingredients-1]] following lines: An ingredient, followed by the quantity remaining, expressed as an integer in grams (respectively centiliters) if it is <1kg (respectively <1L), a float in kg or L otherwise (with at least one digit after the decimal point).
Ingredients must be <<ordered by quantity>>, in ascending order, beginning with <<solid ingredients>> (in g/kg). <<Don't output the [[limiting_ingredient]].>>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You love cooking. Therefore, you often go to the shop to buy ingredients for your recipes. Sometimes, you can't, so you ask your dog to go. But he can't read numbers, so he doesn't buy the quantities you need. Given the recipe and the list of ingredients your dog bought, with their respective quantities, find how many times you can cook this meal before you run out of an ingredient.
Output the first ingredient that will be running out, how many times you can cook, and how much of each ingredient you will have left.
Input
First line: Two integers num_recipe and num_ingredients, respectively the number of lines of the recipe and the number of ingredients your dog bought
num_recipe following lines: A line of the recipe, either an ingredient (beginning with -, then its quantity and its name) or a line to ignore (not beginning with -)
num_ingredients following lines: An ingredient (its name and its quantity) your dog bought

Each quantity is either an integer in g / cl or a float in kg (1000g = 1.0kg) / L (100cl = 1.0L)
Output
First line: limiting_ingredient The ingredient that will run out first
Second line: num_cooking How many times you can cook the meal before you run out of limiting_ingredient
num_ingredients-1 following lines: An ingredient, followed by the quantity remaining, expressed as an integer in grams (respectively centiliters) if it is <1kg (respectively <1L), a float in kg or L otherwise (with at least one digit after the decimal point).
Ingredients must be ordered by quantity, in ascending order, beginning with solid ingredients (in g/kg). Don't output the limiting_ingredient.
Constraints
1<num_ingredients⩽num_recipe<50
0<length of a line<500
The quantity of limiting_ingredient in grams is a multiple of the quantity needed in the recipe, therefore num_cooking is an integer.
There is only one limiting_ingredient.
Example
Input
5 3
- 100g Butter
- 500g Flour
- 500g Sugar
Mix it all together
Eat it !
Butter 400g
Flour 1000g
Sugar 1500g
Output
Flour
2
Butter 200g
Sugar 500g
